H0.text: Christopher Cockerill invented what in 1955. Hovercraft

H1.text: Christopher Cockerill invented what in 1955. Amphibious Vehicle

H2.text: Christopher Cockerill invented what in 1955. Air Cushion Vehicle

H3.text: Christopher Cockerill invented what in 1955. Hoverbarge

A4.text: The idea of the modern hovercraft is most often associated with Christopher Cockerell, a British mechanical engineer.

A5.text: Cockerell's group was the first to develop the use of a ring of air for maintaining the cushion, the first to develop a successful skirt, and the first to demonstrate a practical vehicle in continued use.

A6.text: Cockerell built and tested several models of his hovercraft design in Somerleyton, Suffolk, during the early 1950s.

A7.text: Cockerell came across the key concept in his design when studying the ring of airflow... in the early 1950s.
